author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Universal sued over Tom Cruise movie by informant's family
text:
The Chosunilbo JNS/Multi-Bits via Getty Images Tom Cruise portrays Barry Seal in the upcoming film “Mena.” Tom Cruise’s next movie “Mena” must be shelved indefinitely due to a fraudulently purchased back story, says a daughter of the drug smuggler whose life story is the basis for the film.
In the film, Cruise portrays Barry Seal's journey from South American drug smuggler turned federal informant. Seal was assassinated in 1986 at a Louisiana safe house by Colombian hitmen.
Universal bought the rights to his life story from his third wife and children from that marriage for $350,000, according to the Louisiana Advocate .
But Lisa Seal Frigon, Seal’s daughter from his first marriage, contends in her lawsuit against Universal and the family members that the studio made a deal with the wrong next of kin.
Frigon claims that Seal’s “life story rights” are the property of his estate. As the executor of her father’s estate, she said her consent was required to make a film based on Seal's life.
As part of her suit, Frigon is seeking an injunction against the film’s scheduled 2017 release. A rep for the studio didn’t immediately respond to requests for comment on the lawsuit.
“Mena,” which is filming in Colombia, was rocked by tragedy last month after a small plane assigned to the film’s crew crashed. Two people, including the pilot, were killed, and a third was seriously injured.
